intro: Anemia luetzelburgii, commonly known as the Luetzelburg's anemone, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes buttercups and other showy flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, palmately divided leaves and showy, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
